title: ICE when mis-using self

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
When trying to compile

```
fn main() {}

struct Foo<'a> {
    data: &'a[u8],
}

impl <'a> Foo<'a>{
    fn bar(self: &mut Foo) {
    }
}
```

I get the following:

```
shodan:~$ rustc bug.rs
bug.rs:8:12: 8:29 error: internal compiler error: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(18, BrAnon(1)) <= ReEarlyBound(28, TypeSpace, 0, 'a)
bug.rs:8     fn bar(self: &mut Foo) {
                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
note: the compiler hit an unexpected failure path. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
task 'rustc' failed at 'Box<Any>', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-mac/build/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:113
```
